topic.title: Water weakening compaction

body.p: A new water weakening rock compaction model introduces extra pore volume compaction dependencies on water saturation and initial rock porosity in addition to the pre-existing stress (pressure) dependence. This can be particularly important when modeling compaction in chalk reservoirs. This feature requires a multi-dimensional table of pore volume multipliers as a function of stress, initial porosity, and water saturation.
This feature also includes mechanisms to enable totally elastic rebound for pore volume to recover when pressure reversal occurs.

ul.li: Water weakening model section in the INTERSECT Technical Description
Compaction with water weakening workflow example in the INTERSECT User Guide illustrates the use of water weakening compaction.

fig.title: Pore volume multipliers used for a cell in an injection well for water-weakened compaction effects
